Record.ClassificationPath: Skin and Connective Tissue Diseases/Skin Diseases/Breast Diseases/Lactation Disorders/Galactorrhea
Female Urogenital Diseases and Pregnancy Complications/Pregnancy Complications/Puerperal Disorders/Lactation Disorders/Galactorrhea
Record.BroaderTerm: Female Urogenital Diseases and Pregnancy Complications
Record.Description: Excessive or inappropriate LACTATION in females or males, and not necessarily related to PREGNANCY. Galactorrhea can occur either unilaterally or bilaterally, and be profuse or sparse. Its most common cause is HYPERPROLACTINEMIA.
